metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8630 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The (1) kadm5_create_principal_3 and (2) kadm5_modify_principal functions in lib/kadm5/srv/svr_principal.c in kadmind in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) 1.12.x and 1.13.x before 1.13.4 and 1.14.x before 1.14.1 allow remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) by specifying KADM5_POLICY with a NULL policy name. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled policy names. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8630` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-gss-samples - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-k5tls - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-kdc - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-locales - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-multidev - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-otp - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-pkinit - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
krb5-user - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libgssrpc4 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libk5crypto3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkdb5-8 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkrad0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkrb5-3 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
libkrb5support0 - 1.13.2+dfsg-5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 1.12 ratliff> use of kadmind is not supported in touch and core

criterions.comment: krb5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.13.2+dfsg-5').
